snippet: No one claimed responsibility, but Sunni insurgents, including members of the Islamic State, frequently attack majority-Shiite neighborhoods like those hit.
abstract: Suicide bombers kill more than 50 people and injure nearly 100 in series of attacks across Iraq; no group has claimed responsibility, but Sunni insurgents, including members of Islamic State, frequently attack majority-Shiite neighborhoods like those hit.

byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and employees of The New York Times from Baghdad and Tikrit, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: No one claimed responsibility, but Sunni insurgents, including members of the Islamic State, frequently attack majority-Shiite neighborhoods like those hit.

headline.main: Four Bombings Kill Over 50 People Around Baghdad

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
